The edition you are currently reading is the [color=123123][b]202nd full edition[/b][/color]. To read any older editions of HF News, please go [url=http://goo.gl/pxojJ]here[/url]. 

[align=center][img]http://i.imgur.com/79rvoqQ.png[/img][/align]

[b][color=white]Multiple Groups for Sale[/color][/b]
A few group owners have decided to sell their groups recently. Infamous, Fly by Night, and Zero all opened up sales threads this week. The sales of the groups have been fluctuating from $18,000 to $11,000. Both [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=864480][color=#EFEFEF][b]Sai[/b][/color][/url] and [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1763815][color=#EFEFEF][b]Syrah[/b][/color][/url] retracted their groups from the market, but [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=4066][color=#9999FF][b]Judge Dredd[/b][/color][/url] is still looking for a buyer. If you are interested in buying a group, head over to [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=4066][color=#9999FF][b]Judge Dredd's[/b][/color][/url] thread: [url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4316258][b]Official Group | Infamous For Sale 11K USD *$250 Transfer Fee Waived* BEST DEAL YET![/b][/url]. However, even if you have the cash ready, you must be first be an Ub3r and approved by [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#FF66FF][b]Omniscient[/b][/color][/url] to own a group.

[b][color=white]Multiple Groups are Recruiting[/color][/b]
Many groups are opening their doors to recruit new members. The Empire, Fly by Night, Legion, and The Brotherhood are all recruiting. Both The Brotherhood's Computing sector and Graphics sector are looking for new members. You can apply for the Computing sector on this thread: [url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4150716][b][Updated] The Brotherhood | Computing Sector Recruitment [BHCPU][/b][/url] and you can apply for the Graphics sector on this thread: [url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4334256][b]The Brotherhood | Graphics Sector Recruitment[/b][/url]. You can apply for Legion on this thread: [url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=3542998][b]Legion | Official Hacking Group | Recruitment[/b][/url] and you can apply for Fly by Night on this thread: [url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4331209][b]Fly By Night - Recruitment[/b][/url]. Lastly, you can apply to The Empire on this thread: [url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4331159][b]The Empire - Official Group - General Recruitment[/b][/url].

[b][color=white]Omniscient's Chalazion[/color][/b]
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#FF66FF][b]Omniscient[/b][/color][/url] stated this week that he has a chalazion, a small lesion in the eyelid caused by a blockage of a tiny oil gland in his left eye. This is causing him to have some trouble seeing and thus slowing his regular work schedule. There is a possibility that it can last for months.  Let's all hope [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#FF66FF][b]Omniscient[/b][/color][/url] gets better soon and can see clearly again. You can read more in this thread: [url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4328464][b]Chalazion[/b].[/url]

[b][color=white]Recent Drama with Fly By Night[/color][/b]
Earlier this week [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=884903][color=#383838][b]Unrep[/b][/color][/url], a leader of Fly By Night at the time, had complained about [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=323740][color=#EFEFEF][b]Positive's[/b][/color][/url] signature of his fiance and him kissing. He reported many of [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=323740][color=#EFEFEF][b]Positive's[/b][/color][/url] posts for profile violations without success so he messaged [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#FF66FF][b]Omniscient[/b][/color][/url] about the matter. [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#FF66FF][b]Omniscient[/b][/color][/url] then asked him to prove it was against the rules, which [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=884903][color=#383838][b]Unrep[/b][/color][/url] was unable to do since it was in no violation of any particular rule leading [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#FF66FF][b]Omniscient[/b][/color][/url] to close and rep fuck his account. Following that, two leaders of Fly By Night took 6 month vacation bans, [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=592915][color=black][b]Sasori[/b][/color][/url] and [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=770060][color=black][b]Invisus[/b][/color][/url]. Two members also received signature bans related to this incident, [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1164507][color=#EFEFEF][b]Agitator[/b][/color][/url] and [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1166170][color=#EFEFEF][b]zасh[/b][/color][/url]. The group then went up for sale shortly, but that has now been canceled and it will still be around for now.

[b][color=white]Omnichain Funds Now Up for Reclamation[/color][/b]
Abraham Lincoln has now opened up for [url=www.omnichain.info]Omnichain.info[/url] users to reclaim any coins that may have been stored in the wallet when it was closed down last week. As per [url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4322155]this thread[/url], the coins can now be reclaimed by verifying your account details [url=http://www.givemyomcback.ga/]here[/url]. At the time of writing, another 7,500 OMC is still waiting to be reclaimed by users.

[b][color=white]5,000 OMC Bounty Posted for Code Cleanup[/color][/b]
As announced by Omniscient on May 22nd, the Omnicoin wallet for Windows has been known to trigger false positives with several anti-virus programs. The user [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2339130]dhahn85[/url] has, in [url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4331938]this thread[/url], declared that he will be giving 5,000 OMC to whoever is able to remove the mining utility from the client in order to rid it of its false virus detections. If you wish to give it a try, you can fork the git repository on the Omnicoin team's Github account [url=https://github.com/Omnicoin-Project/Omnicoin/]here[/url].

[color=deepskyblue][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]Interview[/font][/size][/color] [color=white][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]-[/font][/size][/color] [size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2025980]Dark[/url][/font][/size][spoiler=]

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] Welcome to 202nd edition of the HF News, today we're here with Dark. Any shout-outs you'd like to make before we begin?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2025980][color=#EFEFEF][b]D‎‎‏‍‎‏‎‏‍‎‎‏‍‎‏ark:[/b][/color][/url] Hey everyone! Umm the only shout-outs I could give are to the graphic designers of HF, the ones who put true effort into their work, oh and of course my fellow writers from the HFNT.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] So how do you like the news team? Can you inform us what a trial writer is?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2025980][color=#EFEFEF][b]D‎‎‏‍‎‏‎‏‍‎‎‏‍‎‏ark:[/b][/color][/url] Loving the news team actually, at first I expected a very uptight group, you got the work done and there was no fun whilst doing them. How wrong I was, the team of writters probably have more jokes and fun then any other group I have been in and I have been in quite a few! I had been recruited by Sir about a week ago and I wrote for one edition so far (Be sure to check out the audio news guys for edition 201). A trial writer is a writer that is recruited by Sir, you are assigned a section and you write for this section for two editions, whether is be Audio, Gaming etc etc. After you have written for two editions you can then consider yourself a full writer and you can remove the user title below your name.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] I didn't even know some of that, wow. So what do you do outside of the forum?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2025980][color=#EFEFEF][b]D‎‎‏‍‎‏‎‏‍‎‎‏‍‎‏ark:[/b][/color][/url] Yeah, most people don't. I had to do a little research on trial writers to find out fully what I was suppose to do. Outside the forum I play a stupid amount of PC games, Counter Strike, Call Of Duty or whatever the new hit game is at the moment, although every game that comes out nowadays is usually in Pre-Alpha and complete shit, it doesn't stop me from buying them though.. Other then that I go to the gym daily or just chill with friends usually at the weekends smoking or drinking, usually its drinking seeing as I am Irish and the need to drink comes in our DNA.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] Sounds pretty exciting. What are some of your favorite games right now?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2025980][color=#EFEFEF][b]D‎‎‏‍‎‏‎‏‍‎‎‏‍‎‏ark:[/b][/color][/url] Mainly FPS games or CO-OP games, two of my favorites at the moment are CS:GO or for those of you that don't play games that is Counter Strike: Global Offensive, and Arma 2 both really fun games to play with friends.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] I've been into Minecraft lately, but other than that I'm not much of a gamer. Are there any upcoming titles you're looking forward to?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2025980][color=#EFEFEF][b]D‎‎‏‍‎‏‎‏‍‎‎‏‍‎‏ark:[/b][/color][/url] Minecraft was an obsession for me a year or two ago, I would spend hours a day on prison servers, I don't play it anymore at all though. I am actually, I am quite looking forward to a game called "H1Z1" it is a CO-OP zombie survival game, you find guns, food, and resources to survive against zombies and enemy players, with about 300 people per server it should be incredible!

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] I can hardly play BO2 zombies without almost controller chucking my screen, those games aren't for me. So how did you find the forums?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2025980][color=#EFEFEF][b]D‎‎‏‍‎‏‎‏‍‎‎‏‍‎‏ark:[/b][/color][/url] haha, I can't say I agree with you, I love the idea of fighting off hoards of zombies and killing bitches! I found the forums a long time ago from a friend on Hackforums, he used to love gamertags, selling, buying etc. But sadly he doesn't visit HF anymore, but we still play games together with others almost everyday so it's all good. His username on here is Rave if anyone remembers him!

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] I'm a jumpy person and when zombies pop out on me I freak out. Are you much of a console gamer or are you strictly PC?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2025980][color=#EFEFEF][b]D‎‎‏‍‎‏‎‏‍‎‎‏‍‎‏ark:[/b][/color][/url] Haha, the only game I have ever been scared of is the game "Outlast", never play that game.. you won't sleep ever again! I am strictly PC nowadays although when I was younger, between the ages of 10-15 I would live to play xbox, every single day I would spend hours on it. Once I put some money together and bought a decent PC I have never looked back!

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] So why does someone choose PC gaming over console?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2025980][color=#EFEFEF][b]D‎‎‏‍‎‏‎‏‍‎‎‏‍‎‏ark:[/b][/color][/url] I have no idea to be honest, with a console you are limited to what you can do, I mean with a PC setup you could be mid game, tab out and chat a friend on facebook, playing music and watching a movie all at the same time.. I mean if you wanted to. But I think it is down to controls etc, I love using a mouse instead of a joystick, its much more accurate and its all you, no aim assist etc.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] I'm not liking where consoles are going to be completely honest. Money hungry with their services, kids ruining games with no consequences, and no backwards compatibility for old games. Although you've been here for less than a year what keeps you coming back? What's your favorite part of Hack Forums?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2025980][color=#EFEFEF][b]D‎‎‏‍‎‏‎‏‍‎‎‏‍‎‏ark:[/b][/color][/url] Oh I couldn't agree with you more, I left the console scene just as games like Black Ops were coming out, I felt as though every new game that came out was a challenge for hackers to take on and see how quick they could make modded lobbies etc, without much repercussion, hacking is kept to a minimum on PC with VAC anti cheat etc, unless the hackers hide the cheats well, but every game, console will have that no matter how hard they try to get rid of it. Yes, I am relatively new to HF, although I used to watch my friend Rave on it alot over team-viewer, he would show me the ins and outs of HF, it wasn't till maybe a year later I decided to join up myself as I had some accounts to sell. I opened a steam store, for selling steam gifts at one point on HF and I was making money so quickly I didn't know what to do with it, I then learned that you need to know your supplier before you do shit like selling games, accounts etc. Turns out the person I was getting them off for a very low price was carding the games, and buying Russian versions of the games which are significantly cheaper. Sadly, games started getting revoked a month or two later, I was called a carder and a scammer, Paypal charge-backs happened and my Paypal got limited, as a result I couldn't pay anyone back, I took about a month off from HF after that because I couldn't handle the stress. I returned, tried to PM everyone I had dealt with that had games revoked and apologize, some understood, some didn't and I have to live with that. But what brings me back every day is the community of people, I have made friends here and I have laughs constantly at new threads or posts!

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] I'm out there to have a good time and try hards and the gaming "community" (I use the word lightly because I dislike the community). How do you feel about the groups of Hack Forums? Have they improved your experience?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2025980][color=#EFEFEF][b]D‎‎‏‍‎‏‎‏‍‎‎‏‍‎‏ark:[/b][/color][/url] I feel you, sometimes the seriousness gets the better of people, when they forget that its only a game.. not the actual war. Oh groups have improved my experience on HF significantly, apart from hyping up the writers on HF, The Brotherhood is one of my most loved groups, I myself got recruited into the graphics sector of The Brotherhood and since being in their I have been given a project or two from my leader mjaj. The work is great, you get to colab with other artists on the forum and make a ton of new friends on here, where-as when I wasn't in groups finding that right group of friends becomes a lot harder.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] What do you do in The Brotherhood? I was recruited into the spy squad and left a few weeks after it closed because I didn't have a sector, but I do miss the group.
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2025980][color=#EFEFEF][b]D‎‎‏‍‎‏‎‏‍‎‎‏‍‎‏ark:[/b][/color][/url] Graphics is my main sector, but I am more of a lurker, I lurk on threads posted their and posts on those threads, one of my favorites is a "General Lounge and Music" thread, where I actually find some great songs.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] If you could change one thing about the site what would it be?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2025980][color=#EFEFEF][b]D‎‎‏‍‎‏‎‏‍‎‎‏‍‎‏ark:[/b][/color][/url] I'm not sure really, I think the site runs well the rules are there and the people to enforce those rules are also, I mean if I had to change anything, I would like to see a few more Awards added, not purchasable, but maybe some awards that are a bit more easy to obtain, I feel as though unless you purchase and award, if you aren't well known on HF you don't really have a chance to get one. But that is just my opinion.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] Well I appreciate you taking the time to partake in this interview, but sadly that's all the time I have. Do you have any concluding remarks you'd like to make.
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2025980][color=#EFEFEF][b]D‎‎‏‍‎‏‎‏‍‎‎‏‍‎‏ark:[/b][/color][/url] Not really, I just wan't to say thanks so much for the interview I had great fun doing it, and to all my fans, I will be signing autographs at 9PM EST the day this is released! Peace!
[/spoiler]

[color=deepskyblue][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]Interview[/font][/size][/color] [color=white][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]-[/font][/size][/color] [size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1042439]~HF~[/url][/font][/size]
[spoiler=][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952870][color=#2E64FE][b]Alien:[/b][/color][/url] Welcome to the 202nd edition of the HF News, today we're here with ~HF~. Any shout-outs you'd like to make before we begin?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1042439][color=#EFEFEF][b]~HF~:[/b][/color][/url] First off I would like to say thanks for selecting me to be interviewed, it's a great honor. I would like to give a massive shout-out to Enterprise. I love being the leader of such an amazing group. There will be big things to come in the next few weeks.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952870][color=#2E64FE][b]Alien:[/b][/color][/url] Interesting you mention that. How are things going with the group?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1042439][color=#EFEFEF][b]~HF~:[/b][/color][/url] There going very well actually, thanks for asking. We have launched our monetizing help desk which has been very popular and already has 14 pages. We will be expanding our group and doing more things outside the SF in a few weeks as promised.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952870][color=#2E64FE][b]Alien:[/b][/color][/url] The group is currently at just 16 members. Is the group going to grow a lot more or is it going to remain relatively small?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1042439][color=#EFEFEF][b]~HF~:[/b][/color][/url] Actually in a weeks time I will be kicking some members who have failed to pay the $100 from comissions from my methods and who have not posted a "HQ" thread inside or outside the SF. So the group size will be decreasing but after that we won't be recruiting for a while due to our work on some group projects. These will not be group products but rather a website and expanding Enterprise onto other forums.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952870][color=#2E64FE][b]Alien:[/b][/color][/url] What sort of products or other general monetizing techniques do you employ?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1042439][color=#EFEFEF][b]~HF~:[/b][/color][/url] Well, we are planning on releasing a website. I can't disclose the information of what will be on this website but I can say it won't have any products and it will be free to use. As I have said to many people, we won't be releasing any products for now until we build a name for ourselves. But I can say people are partnering up inside Enterprise to make unique products that will be related to monetizing.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952870][color=#2E64FE][b]Alien:[/b][/color][/url] You mentioned in your pre-interview you would like to one day own your own group. Do you feel with your techniques and methods this goal will be reached?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1042439][color=#EFEFEF][b]~HF~:[/b][/color][/url] I think one day I can reach my goal as long as groups stay around the $10-$12k mark. I think by the time I reach my goal I will have moved on from Hack Forums and may have changed my mind about spending so much on a group on a forum. I know 3-4 groups owners are actually selling their groups and most of them are also leaving HF. I think I will do the same by the time I reach my goal but I guess only time will tell.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952870][color=#2E64FE][b]Alien:[/b][/color][/url] You have posted a lot in the Runescape and LoL forums here on HF. Do you consider yourself a pretty big gamer?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1042439][color=#EFEFEF][b]~HF~:[/b][/color][/url] I used to be a big gamer but now I've moved on to more serious things like monetizing. However, I still like to play LoL and I play it at least once a day. I'm currently only Gold and plan to get Plat by the end of the season. I'm actually going to play a game after this interview, haha.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952870][color=#2E64FE][b]Alien:[/b][/color][/url] Do you have a job outside of HF or do you earn all of your money via monetizing methods?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1042439][color=#EFEFEF][b]~HF~:[/b][/color][/url] I'm only 17 actually so I currently don't have any spare time to have a job. I used to work in an frozen yogurt shop and I sometimes help out with my dad's business. I earn all my money via monetizing mainly.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952870][color=#2E64FE][b]Alien:[/b][/color][/url] Where do you live and do you plan to go to college? What sort of a career are you interested in persuing?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1042439][color=#EFEFEF][b]~HF~:[/b][/color][/url] I live in Essex in the UK. I'm currently studying: Business, Economics, ICT and Math at sixth form. I would like a career that has something to do with finance and my dream job would be to be a investment banker.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952870][color=#2E64FE][b]Alien:[/b][/color][/url] You certainly are passionate about business and earning income. Besides gaming, what hobbies do you have outside of HF?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1042439][color=#EFEFEF][b]~HF~:[/b][/color][/url] I used to play cricket for Essex and actually I was very good at it. I even got scouted for a trial with an England cricket team but sadly I lost interest and gave up in the end. I don't really have any hobbies but I like just going out with my friends and chilling. Like today I just went to the gym then to the park, played some football and chilled with a lot of people.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952870][color=#2E64FE][b]Alien:[/b][/color][/url] What do you think of this edition of the World Cup? There's been a lot of drama and it isn't even over yet.
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1042439][color=#EFEFEF][b]~HF~:[/b][/color][/url] I think its been very exciting but I feel quite bad for Brazil for the massive loss in their home country. Germany were the better team and showed it by dominating Brazil. I think Germany will go on to win the World Cup this year.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952870][color=#2E64FE][b]Alien:[/b][/color][/url] I share the same feelings. Is there anything we did not discus today that you'd like to bring up?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1042439][color=#EFEFEF][b]~HF~:[/b][/color][/url] Actually, no. We talked about quite a lot of things. I would just like to say thanks for the interview as it was very interesting and fun for me.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952870][color=#2E64FE][b]Alien:[/b][/color][/url] You're welcome and thank you for your participation.
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1042439][color=#EFEFEF][b]~HF~:[/b][/color][/url] Would just like to say thank you to members of Hack Forums who have made the site enojyable for me. Would like to give a shout-out to some groups who have kept me from leaving HF: The brotherhood, Illuminati and Enterprise. Thank you.
[/spoiler]

[color=deepskyblue][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]Interview[/font][/size][/color] [color=white][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]-[/font][/size][/color] [size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=68378]Canon[/url][/font][/size][spoiler=]

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] Welcome to 203rd edition of the HF News, today we're here with Canon. Any shout-outs you'd like to make before we begin?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=68378][color=white][b]Canon:[/b][/color][/url] Hey there, mate. Thanks for taking the time out of your day to interview me. Sadly, after 5 years of being on HF, I haven't really gotten close to many people on the forums, so no shoutouts from me.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] Well I'll be your new best friend, you're going to have a lot of jealous kids. So tell me Canon how did you stumble across Hack Forums?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=68378][color=white][b]Canon:[/b][/color][/url] That'd be great! The story of how I stumbled on HackForums is, I'm sure, like many others. Back in 2007 I used to play a lot of Runescape and I really really sucked at the game. I would get scammed by people because I was too trusting and it made me very frustrated with the game. So I started searching the internet for ways to get ahead in the game (by hacking) and I stumbled upon HackForums. It seemed really frightening, since HF was much much much bigger than any other forums I had ever been on, so I just lurked about for a long time.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] It's scary how similar out stories are, but a few years off. I would play Halo 3 and was hacked and was too nervous to join, but finally did. that's funny. Have you learned anything since joining the forums? Has it helped you hack all of the RS hacker boyz?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=68378][color=white][b]Canon:[/b][/color][/url] I've learned not to ask for rep and to think hard before repping someone haha. A few years ago, I mistakenly repped someone who was new to the community since I felt bad for him, knowing how difficult it could be at first to fit into a new forums, especially one as large as HackForums. So after I repped him, one day I came on to find that I'd been repfucked by Omni since the person that I had repped turned out to be a multi accounting ban evading scumbag. Oh well. It was a lesson to be learned and thankfully I didn't lose too much rep (200+). I actually gave up on Runescape a few days after joining HackForums since I felt that the game was too repetitive and frustrating. I now play another game that I get frustrated with a lot, League of Legends. :)

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] I'll get to league in a question or two, but being a 2009 member what are some of the things you miss or that have changed that have impacted the way you feel about Hack Forums?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=68378][color=white][b]Canon:[/b][/color][/url] I miss the fact that people back then seemed a lot nicer than they are now. Nowadays, I see people getting -repped for stupid reasons, such as having an opinion on something which someone disagreed with. It's really childish, honestly, but being on a forum filled with a bunch of adolescents, what can you expect, eh?

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] I feel that the community is only concerned about themselves and a lot of people have become egotistical assholes, pardon my French. It has gone downhill since when I joined in 2011. So what do you do outside the forums? Going to school? Working? Any exciting hobbies?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=68378][color=white][b]Canon:[/b][/color][/url] I agree with you fully. I guess the old members either grew out of it or got banned. Outside the forums, I'm pretty much a couch potato. I do play some badminton and tennis though. I currently go to school at the University of Tulsa, majoring in Petroleum Engineering and it's pretty great. Being summer, however, I'm back at home with my parents, leeching off them hahaha. I can't wait to go back to school in about a month though.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] I'm 21 myself and I feel like I've grown out of the drama and don't even bother with it. I'm taking one class, but can't wait to head back to school, sorry for being ignorant, but could you explain to those reading what a Petroleum Engineer does.
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=68378][color=white][b]Canon:[/b][/color][/url] Sure thing. I'm sure all of you know that, to make your cars run, you need to go to the gas station and fill up. What I do is look for that gas using geographic and geologic maps, taking into account certain formations in the earth that would contain oil and gas. I then would drill in that location using the appropriate equipment, seeking to get as much oil and gas as I can, while keeping our costs as low as possible.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] Interesting thing to study... Sounds more interesting than my psychology major. So why league? I don't get the obsession behind the game. What draws players towards it?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=68378][color=white][b]Canon:[/b][/color][/url] I'm sure psychology is interesting! There're loads of people studying it at my university too, and I'm sure that no one would study it if it weren't interesting. Hmm. I first started playing league in early 2011. At first, it was a way to unwind after a long day at school. My brother played it, my friends played it, so I decided that I would give it a shot. So over the next few months, I familiarised myself with the game and then it really got addicting. I'm a highly competitive person by nature and when I saw my friends getting decent ranks in League, I wanted that for myself. However, due to League's toxic community, I'm ashamed to say that I was toxic too for a long time. I would rage, scream, threaten to AFK and all that, for the simple reason that people were not listening to calls. It got so bad that I quit League several times over the years because I found that I was getting more annoyed playing than not playing the game. I reinstalled it a couple of months ago, though, and I'm learning to control my anger when I play.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] I could never get myself to play it, partially for having a computer on the brink of exploding when running games. Do you play any other games or are you strictly a league player?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=68378][color=white][b]Canon:[/b][/color][/url] On my PC, I'm pretty much a strict League player. I used to play it 7 hours a day, but I've cut down to a maximum of 2 hours a day, now that I'm busy with university and all. I recently bought a new playstation, because I've seen that a friend of mine has pre-ordered Assassin's Creed: Unity which comes out this fall and it looks so bloody good that I just had to play it. I also play some GTA V sometimes when I'm looking to unwind.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] I have GTA 5, but have yet to play it, I'm still stuck on BO2. Have you dabbled with groups on Hack Forums? How do you feel about them?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=68378][color=white][b]Canon:[/b][/color][/url] Damn, you really should man. The graphics, gameplay and storyline is amazing! Back in the day, I was really interested in the groups of HF, since I really didn't have many friends, so I would apply to some groups in the hopes of getting accepted. I still remember that I was accepted to Reverence and I was so excited. Sadly, Reverence closed down about a week later (if I'm not mistaken) and whenever I think about applying to another group, I dissuade myself due to lack of time and commitment. It'd be cool to join some groups, such as Nexus though, since they're hardcore League players too. But right now? No plans to join any group :) (Writers has interested me, but I doubt I'd get accepted :P)

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] I miss the groups from when I first joined. I feel that the same kids are accepted into the same groups and this site has become a giant popularity contest for high school kids, makes me sick. How would you rate your overall Hack Forums experience on a scale of 1-10?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=68378][color=white][b]Canon:[/b][/color][/url] I hear you man. That's pretty much how I feel. Hmm I really love Hack Forums and the people on it (minus the trolls, assholes, fools), so I'm going to say 9.5. It could be better, but I'm glad that I made the decision to sign up for Hack Forums.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] If you could change one thing about the site what would it be?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=68378][color=white][b]Canon:[/b][/color][/url] I would really like a usergroup on HackForums (something like ub3r) but for people who actually contribute a lot and are dedicated to HackForums. I'm sorry, but I feel that there are too many people getting accepted to ub3r. I've seen people who're here for like a month with 300 posts getting accepted. It sort of makes it feel not special anymore, you know?

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] The standards have gone down, I still remember spending about an hour and PM'ing Omniscient why I deserved my spot... It was actually was a tough task getting accepted. Well I appreciate you taking the time out of your night for an interview, but I'm afraid that's all the time I have for tonight. Do you have any final remarks you'd like to make?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=68378][color=white][b]Canon:[/b][/color][/url] I'd just like to say thanks for taking the time out of your night to interview me. I know how busy you must be. Long live HackForums!
[/spoiler]

[align=center]By [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1189774][color=#EFEFEF][b]Bandors[/b][/color][/url] & [b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1173142][color=#EFEFEF]Goodies[/color][/url][/b][/align]
[align=center][spoiler=][align=left]
[b][color=white]Indexeus.org Hacked by Pernicious Developers[/color][/b]
As many people are aware, the member [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1642244][color=#00AAFF][b]Dubitus™[/b][/color][/url], recently started a controversial website, [url=http://indexeus.org]Indexeus[/url] which is a database search engine that indexes several thousand database entries to acquire names, addresses, passwords, and other relatively-personal data. A hackforums-based group called Pernicious Developers seized the website and uploaded a deface page. Comprised of HF members [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1255973][color=#EFEFEF][b]Zayne[/b][/color][/url], [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1198761][color=#EFEFEF][b]Sky[/b][/color][/url], [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=128873][color=#EFEFEF][b]T3h Hack3r[/b][/color][/url], [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1047578][color=#00AAFF][b]schmidt73[/b][/color][/url], [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=846590][color=#00AAFF][b]AntiPaste[/b][/color][/url], and [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=679969][color=#383838][b]teozmodz123[/b][/color][/url], a member of the group, according to [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1642244][color=#00AAFF][b]Dubitus™[/b][/color][/url], was allegedly given access to the website to perform minor updates. This has yet to be confirmed. It is unknown which members have partaken in the attack, but the group's name and logo was uploaded on the front page of [url=http://indexeus.org]Indexeus[/url] for all to see. As far as we can tell, it may not be a matter of web application insecurity but rather giving too many people the password to the website. Let this be a lesson to all Website Developers; you never know who you're giving access to your site.

[b][color=white]NSA Members Share Illegally Acquired Nude Photos[/color][/b]
For a long time now, the National Security Agency (NSA) has been illegally spying on U.S. citizens' phone calls, internet usage, and emails. As the world-famous whistleblower, Edward Snowden, claims that NSA employees would routinely share intercepted nude photos with one another. Due to the seemingly ironic lack of auditing in the NSA's private network, no members are held accountable and these "crimes" are reported to no-one. An NSA spokesman addressed this issue but suspiciously did not deny the allegations.
[list][i]“NSA is a professional foreign-intelligence organization with a highly trained workforce, including brave and dedicated men and women from our armed forces; as we have said before, the agency has zero tolerance for willful violations of the agency’s authorities or professional standards, and would respond as appropriate to any credible allegations of misconduct."[/i]
- NSA Spokesman Vanee Vines
[/list]

[b][color=white]Vulnerable Cisco Gateway Web Servers[/color][/b]
Various Cisco Wireless Gateways have a vulnerability in processing Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) requests. The exploit triggers a buffer overflow exploit which can allow an attacker to execute arbitrary commands with elevated privileges. This attack has deservedly earned a [b][color=#FF6347]Critical[/color][/b] rating the the Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) as it allows a remote user to trigger a vulnerability that gives them full access to the router. From there, they can perform several malicious attacks such as changing the DNS servers to malicious ones, changing routing tables, and packet sniffing, among others. Cisco has released a free software update that addresses this vulnerability. Several common devices such as VoIP Cable Modems and Residential Wireless Gateways are affected allowing potentially millions of devices to be exploited.
[/align][/spoiler][/align]

[align=center][img]http://i.imgur.com/Gm7w7ET.png[/img][/align]

[align=center][b]By [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=255459]Delirium™[/url] & [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2064999]Kamzare[/url][/b][/align]
[align=center][spoiler=][align=left]

[b][color=white]10.000$ Reward To Whoever Hacks A Tesla Model S[/color][/b]
The organizers of the Syscan conference, which will take place in Beijing next week, are offering the reward of 10.000 USD to whoever hacks the system of a Tesla Model S car. According to Forbes, the organizers are looking for specific attacks that could lead to the remote control of the car or redirecting the web browser of it to a website containing malware. The reason behind picking a Tesla car for hacking tests is the fact that the manufacturer takes its products' security into account very seriously. However, the company itself is not involved in any part of the conference.

[b][color=white]Zero-Day Vulnerability Found On Gmail's Application For iOS[/color][/b]
A vulnerability which allows a possible intruder to gain access to the encrypted traffic, between the official Gmail application for iOS and Google's servers, using a Man-in-the-middle attack, has been found by security researchers. The vulnerability lies on the fact that the application is not using the official certificate, which validates the connection. This exploitation way is called "certificate pinning". The aforementioned application does not use a valid certificate, which makes it possible for an attacker to spoof the certificate and gain access to sensitive information. A company named Lagoon mobily security has stated that the vulnerability has been reported to Google but no patch has been released so far.

[b][color=white]Advanced Variants Of Kivars Malware Targeting x64 Bit Machines[/color][/b]
Due to the increased adoption of x64 bit machines, malware programmers have been altering their viruses to target specific architectures. New variants of the old Kivars Malware, which was targeting x86 machines, have been found working on x64 architectures. According to Trend Micro researchers, Kivars works as an ordinary Remote Administration Tool (RAT) and it is using a variant of the RC4 algorithm to encrypt the connection between he client and the server. They also found out that the malware's vendors are also using PoisonRAT, which is another Remote Administration Tool working the same way.
[/align][/spoiler][/align]

[align=center][img]http://i.imgur.com/TvznEMg.png[/img][/align]

[align=center][b]By [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1698590]Abide[/url] & [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1079277]Harlem[/url][/b][/align]
[align=center][spoiler=][align=left]

[b][color=white]Netflix Is Testing a Private Mode[/color][/b]
Let’s be honest, sometimes we pick odd movies to watch on Netflix. Netflix understands the importance of privacy, and select Netflix employees have been given the “Privacy Mode” feature. The privacy mode works by hiding your viewed titles from the Recently Viewed section and future recommendations. This is one of the many suggestions from Netflix customers over the past few years. Based on the results of this test, we might see this new feature in the settings menu soon. 

[b][color=white]Google Confronts Samsung Over Smartwatches[/color][/b]
Google and Samsung have had an unsteady relationship for a while now. Most of their issues are over Android customization, and the dissatisfaction is now a part of the wearable world. Recent reports claim that Google CEO Larry Page had a heated conversation with Samsung regarding its decision to invest more into the Gear 2 and Gear Fit rather than the Android packing Gear Live.  Nobody knows exactly what was said in the conversation, but it is obvious that Google wants Samsung to pay more attention to the Android-based platform. In fact, Google wanted to delay Samsung in making wrist technology until Android Wear was ready. Samsung is trying to be more independent and less reliant on Google’s Android operating system.

[b][color=white]Jibo: The World's First Family Robot[/color][/b]
Dr. Cynthia Breazeal, a robotics researcher at MIT has made a campaign on Indiegogo. Cynthia’s goal is to “humanize” technology, and she has already raised over $700,000 for her project named Jibo. Jibo is a social robot that can see, hear, speak, and assist you. Jibo has the ability to track faces and take group photos. When Jibo is connected with an automated home, it can turn on lights and adjust the temperature. Jibo dances and replies in a friendly way that attracts children to be attached to the device. In fact, Jibo even can read bedtime stories and displays interactive images on the 5.7 inch touchscreen display. This is just the beginning for Jibo and they have a lot to add, but it is expected to be released late next year for an estimated $499. If you would like to see the demo of Jibo, click the spoiler below.
[sp][yt]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3N1Q8oFpX1Y[/yt][/sp]

[/align][/spoiler][/align]

[align=center][img]http://i.imgur.com/HeflzKQ.png[/img][/align]

[align=center][b]By [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1093501]Roger Waters[/url] & [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1030620]CyborgIzSoBeast[/url][/b][/align]
[align=center][spoiler=][align=left]

[b][color=white]Doom comes to League of Legends[/color][/b]
Recently added 'League of Legend's game mode "Doom Bots" has players roaming through the bushes and last hitting minion, utterly astonished at what they are witnessing. The new mode adds the elements of nightmares into the game and has players flashing and recalling back to base with their knees still shaking. Riot released three playable difficulty levels for the new Doom Bots mode: one bomb, three bomb, and the horrifying five bomb difficulty. The first level is available to all players immediately, but the others need to be unlocked by achieving a victory against the agonizingly strong bot team in the difficulty preceding it. After defeating all the difficulties, players will receive a Doom Bot Icon that they can show off on their Summoner's profile.

[b][color=white]Doom officially unveiled at QuakeCon[/color][/b]
After months of teases, mentions, and a beta announcement, the newest Doom video game was unveiled at QuakeCon this week. According to according to executive producer Marty Stratton, the game will return to the franchise's roots, marking a reboot for the franchise. A trailer lasting over 20-minutes was revealed to attendees at the reveal, but due to a media blackout, the trailer was not revealed to the general public. Along with the trailer reveal, it was announce that the game will be developed for the Play Station 4, Xbox One, and the PC. The game will use the id Tech 6 engine and will reportedly run at 1080p and 60 frames-per-second on all platforms. According to a report by Polygon, the game will begin outside of a UAC research facility on Mars at the beginning of a  demonic invasion. The game will also feature several guns, including the fan-favorite double-barrel shotgun, rocket launcher, plasma rifle, and a chainsaw. An element from the old school games will return, allowing players to hold every weapon in the game, accessible through a radial wheel. There will also be health pickups, but health will not regenerate. It was announced a few months ago that Doom was taken back to the drawing board after failing to meet expectations through internal employees, Bethesda stated: “An earlier version of Doom 4 did not exhibit the quality and excitement that id and Bethesda intend to deliver and that Doom fans worldwide expect. As a result, id refocused its efforts on a new version of Doom 4 that promises to meet the very high expectations everyone has for this game and this franchise. When we’re ready to talk about the Doom 4 id is making, we will let folks know.”

[b][color=white]The Sims 4 Premium Service Revealed[/color][/b]
A lengthy new game play video released today showing off The Sims 4 has revealed Electronic Arts has plans for something called The Sims 4 Premium, a service that includes early access to new content. When entering the gallery (an in-game area where you can download content created by other Sims players), an advertisement for The Sims 4 Premium is briefly seen on-screen (via Eurogamer). Below the Premium name, the following text is displayed: "Become a Premium member to get early access to 3 new packs, with exclusive items. Your Sims can throw a spooky costume party, camp in the great outdoors, and toast to the new year in style." Given the name, the comparison that immediately comes to mind is the Battlefield Premium service. In that case, a one-time $50 fee gets you early access to all of the downloadable content released for the current Battlefield game, as well as exclusive in-game items and cosmetic options. For gamers who would buy all of the DLC individually, the $50 price presents a discount.

[b][color=white]Release Dates for the Weeks of July 12 and July 20, 2014:[/color][/b]
[list]
[*]Freedom Planet - Linux, Mac, PC - July 19, 2014
[*]Forza Motorsport 5: Game of the Year Edition - Xbox One - July 22, 2014
[*]Oddworld: New 'n' Tasty! - Play Station 4 - July 22, 2014
[*]OlliOlli - Linux, Mac, PC - July 22, 2014
[*]The Walking Dead: Season Two - Episode 4: Amid The Ruins - Mac, PC, Play Station Network, Play Station Vita, Xbox Live Arcade - July 22, 2014
[*]Unrest - Linux, Mac, PC - July 23, 2014
[/list]
[align=center][sp=Gaming Video of the Week][yt]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BhM2CefzhJ8[/yt][/sp][/align]
[/align][/spoiler][/align]

[align=center][img]http://i.imgur.com/lJ3tOFY.png[/img][/align]

[align=center][b]By [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1213511]Onіx[/url] & [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1306528]xadamxk[/url][/b][/align]
[align=center][spoiler=][align=left]

[b][color=white]Google adds support for screen mirroring on Chromecast[/color][/b]
Google is now pushing an update to the Android Chromecast app, releasing as v1.7 on the Play Store. It adds support for screen mirroring; a feature directly aimed towards outdoing the Apple TV. Up until now screen mirroring without the use of complicated workarounds was not possible on the Chromecast and was the main flaw that kept it's competitor, the Apple TV, relevant. Now though, the $30 dongle is really proving to be a good investment. [b][color=white]Avast proves 'Factory Wipe' settings are not secure[/color][/b]
Avast, in an attempt to promote their Android security app, has posted an article on their blog detailing how they recovered large amounts of data from 'wiped' phones they purchased from eBay. They purchased 20 phones and in just those few they recovered over 20,000 photos, including a large number of naked selfies. Even text messages and Facebook messages were restored. They used free and cheap data recovery programs to prove that almost anyone could perform the task on a used phone. Apple has released the third iteration of their Beta versions for the upcoming iOS 8 update. It is being sent out via OTA or via iTunes to all devices which have their UDIDs listed on a developer account. There are the usual small bug fixes for crashes as per every update but the main features added were to do with Apple's new Health app. These include a Caffeine tracker which in no doubt will always be high for most of us and also a Steps tracker that will use the M7 coprocessor as an input, requiring no 3rd party accessories. According to reports, this Beta may be the last before the final GM edition gets released.

[b][color=white]Uncharged devices may be confiscated at all UK airports[/color][/b]
The UK Government has followed suit after the US has issued a warning saying that security checks at airports for international and internal flights will now include checking to see if mobile devices can power on. This follows leaks from Islamic terrorist groups that bombs are being designed to hide inside small, fake, devices. The government have been very vague with the announcement and have not said if a low battery screen will count as powering on or not. British Airways and Virgin Atlantic are the only companies to have commented officially so far and both have said that they will keep phones for passengers to collect on their return flight if they are barred from flying with it.[url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-28223150]Source[/url][/align][/spoiler][/align]

[b][color=white]Malaysia Airlines Plane Shot Down Over Ukraine[/color][/b]
A Malaysia Airlines passenger plane, labelled MH17, was shot down this week over eastern Ukraine. The plane was carrying 295 passengers which are all suspected dead and was flying over a pro-Russian separatists occupied zone. Many are dubbing the incident as the start of "World War III" and is now the second time a plane has been shot down close to Russia. The rebels occupying the zone have given permission to officials to investigate the wreckage and reports emerging from CBS say the incident was caused by a surface-to-air missile. Russia and Ukraine are currently trading the blame of the downing of the plane to each other and it remains unclear which side caused this.

[b][color=white]Israel Begins Invasion On Gaza[/color][/b]
Israeli ground forces which were backed by artillery and airstrikes made a push towards Gaza city in a bid to force Palestinian militant group "Hamas" out of the city. The conflict between the two has been happening for over 10-days now and it is unclear what made the Israeli force decide to invade but a spokesman for Israel Defense Forces has said: “we have hit Hamas hard and we will continue to hit Hamas hard” providing evidence the group will not stop the attack. What makes the invasion rather peculiar is that Israeli forces have made it clear in recent days they do not wish to occupy Gaza city, which would "create a host of new problems", instead they wish to destroy the Hamas military force occupying the city, which would then stop the shooting from Gaza into Israel. Thousands also marched through London to protest the actions happening in Gaza.

[b][color=white]US Emergency Action Broadcasts[/color][/b]
On the 18th of July, [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=469528]Odin the Wanderer[/url] reported that the [url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4344903]US Emergency Action Message[/url] was being broadcasted and it left many users curious. Although these messages can not be decoded, it is still interesting listening to the them and something that can be worked out is the importance of the message. For example, a message starts with "Skyking Skyking DO NOT ANSWER", the number of times this is repeated indicates the importance. Once means the message could just be a test, twice means its slightly important but still possibly a test, three times means the message is highly important and four times means it is urgent and possibly 'nuclear level' of importance. Callsigns are then spoken, such as "Juliet, Romeo, Hotel, Romeo" until the message is over. Again, these can not be decoded but it is fun to listen and many members agree with the thread nearing to 700 replies of discussion on the topic.

[b][color=white]Bolivia Is The First Country To Legalize Child Labour[/color][/b]
Bolivia is now the first country to legalize child labour. The law was signed by Vice President Alvaro Garcia Linera and was approved by a Congress and what this means is the age to work has now been lowered from 14 down to 10. Children 10 and above can now become self-employed as long as they are still enrolled in school and they have their parents permission, where-as children 12 and over will be able to take on contract work, again with consent by their parents and compulsory school attendance. The law was passed by the government to help those Bolivians who are living in poverty and to allow and additional income.

All 5 members of the crew were killed with another one being injured on ground. The cause of the incident is still unclear but a car dash-camera captured the moment it crashed into the ground nose first and as soon as it hit the ground the helicopter exploded with a large fireball. The helicopter had been previously looking for survivors of a ferry that had sunk in April but had returned empty handed. Many of those on-board the ferry when it sank are reported to be high school students.

[b][color=white]A 1,000 Bitcoin Idea[/color][/b]
Back in 2005, English college student Alex Tew had a $1 million dollar idea: create a website with 1 million pixels, and sell each pixel for $1. The website sold all 1 million pixels, and Alex Tew supposedly received his $1 million. Eventually, the site faded from existence, and became part of Internet history. From this idea recently spawned "The 1,000 Bitcoin Homepage"; people can buy pixels on this site for Bitcoins, which will eventually equal up to 1,000 Bitcoins once every pixel is purchased. There has been no word as to who is behind the 1,000 Bitcoin Homepage idea, but there is a Twitter account for the site, which can be found [url=https://twitter.com/1000btcpage]here[/url].

[b][color=white]Will Bitcoin Make Banks Obsolete?[/color][/b]
Many people have stated, and agreed, that Bitcoin could easily come to replace banks in the near future. Some have come to compare the situation to the rise of online retail stores and the fall of shopping malls; stating that Bitcoin could revolutionize the way that currency is used. Mainly based around 3 facts: Bitcoins cannot be counterfeited, they are available anywhere in the world at any time, and there is no inflation. Today, a person doesn't even have to leave their home to purchase clothes. You can just hop on your computer and get anything, and everything delivered to your door. One of the only remaining elements of the old economic model is the means of exchange itself i.e. currency. Hopefully, we see some changes in the near future, as I (personally) support the Bitcoin movement.

[color=white][b]Overtreatment of prostate cancer must be stopped.[/b][/color]
Prostate is one of the most momentous diseases in the U.S In 2014, the ACS (American Cancer Society) is estimating there will be 233,000 men who will be diagnosed with it and 29,480 will die from it (in the U.S alone). This week, two major studies have been published in the JAMA Internal Medicine journal on how the U.S is treating patients who are diagnosed with prostate cancer. The results from these articles should alert those who treat prostate cancer along with the organizations who help spread awareness. The studies have concluded that a excessive amount of men who are diagnosed with prostate cancer get extremely aggressive & unnecessary treatments. Some of these cases have shown that doing this results in the treatment being useless & causing more damage. 

[color=white][b]Alcohol abuse - Can fish oil really help the damage?[/color][/b]
PLOS ONE has conducted a study that concluded omega-3 fish oil could protect parts of the brain that have been damaged by alcohol abuse. Adding on to a meta-analysis performed by Loyola University Chicago Stritch School of Medicine in Illinois who concluded drinking alcohol in moderation (2 drinks for men; 1 for women) a day  may reduce risk of dementia and cognitive impairment during aging. To further investigate this omega-3 fish oil study, a study was conducted on adult rat brain cells. In the course of a week, the cells were exposed of concentration levels of alcohol 4 times time normal drinking level (which is normally seen in chronic alcoholics). Research showed the cells that had omega-3 docosahexaenoic acid (DHA; compound in fish oil) showed 90% neuronal death & less neuroinflammation (less inflammation in nervous tissues) in brain cells that had been exposed to DHA than those that haven't. The team is doing prolonged research to continue this study.

[color=white][b]HIV decreased death rate from some causes.[/b][/color]
In this world, the amount of people with HIV globally is around 35.3 million, with 1.6 million deaths from AIDS-related illnesses worldwide, which was discovered in 2012. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) reports there are over 1.1 million people in the US present with HIV, and almost 1 in 6 people (15.8%) have not been diagnosed. cardiovascular disease and liver disease decreased, compared with a decade ago. 
AIDS-related causes have [u]decreased[/u] from [i]34%[/i] to only [i]22%[/i].
Liver disease - [u]decreased[/u] from [i]16%[/i] to [i]10%.[/i] 
These studies have shown Non-AIDS cancers are now the leading the non-AIDS cause of death in people with HIV. Study also showed that Non-AIDS cancers - [u]increased[/u] from [i]9%[/i] to [i]23%.[/i] 

[color=white][b]Stem-cell Cancer Treatment is found to make HIV Undetectable[/b][/color]
Two Australian men, both diagnosed HIV positive, have tested with extremely low levels of the virus. This is believed to be a result of receiving stem-cells, originally in order to treat cancer. Now the two men are testing completely HIV negative, although both are on antiretroviral therapy. This is not the first incident of stem-cell transplants “erasing” HIV. Two similar cases were reported a year ago. One received a transplant in 2011 when he needed new bone marrow to treat non-Hodgkin’s lymphoma while the second patient got his treatment for leukemia in 2012. However, the virus resurfaced after the patients stopped taking antiretroviral therapy. The two patients currently testing HIV free will continue to stay on antiretroviral therapy.

[color=white][b]Asthma medication - Linked to growth suppression in children.[/b][/color]
Newest studies involving inhaled cortisones - inhalers given to patients with asthma have found these inhales have drugs that appear to prevent the growth rate of children, worrying the physicians and the parents. The effect of inhaled cortisones have a severe impact on children. A study of 25 trials, involving  8,471 children with mild to moderate asthma. Within the 25 trials, 14 of them have shown only a measly 5,717 children measured growth in a year. The ICS studies have resulted that non-steroidal drugs,  showed 6-9cm average growth a year, and 0.5cm growth was reduced a year with the steroidal drugs. 

[color=white][b]Brain disease - Successfully on worms.[/b][/color]
University of Liverpool researchers have conducted a study that showed a extremely dangerous and life threatening neurodegenerative disease has been treated IN worms. These scientists have studied adult onset neuronal lipofuscinosis (ANCL) which usually strikes around 1 in 100,000 people in Europe and North America around their mid 30s, killing them in their mid 40s and there is currently no known treatment. Humans have a gene called DNAJC5, which is the same gene as a gene for worms called dnj-14. The researched team has concluded resveratrol can be treat the disease in ways that have not been previously seen - which stops the bodies need to produce an enzyme in the body called SIR-2.1.

[color=white][b]Goodbye Malaria- At a Moral Cost[/b][/color]
Malaria, the cause of death of over 600,000 people each year, has recently met its match. Recent studies have shown that science stands a chance at defeating Malaria. For years injection after injection have been made to prevent the development of Malaria, but the tables have turned. The new idea is to take the disease from its biggest transporter by alternating mosquito DNA. The name for it is Crispr. While a Malaria-free world is desperately needed, genetically engineering a wild species is also morally shaky. Crispr is an order of molecules that allow precise DNA alternation. Scientists would insert Crispr as well as malaria parasite-resistant genes into lab mosquitos. The insects would then be released into the wild to mate. Each generation of offspring would reproduce the newly engineered genes, making Malaria parasites resistant in each mosquito the genes reach. It is estimated that with this approach it would take a few short years to make an entire population of mosquitoes resistant.

[color=white][b]HIV care at home increases the use of antiretroviral therapy.[/b][/color]
In the African country of Malawi, adults were offered HIV-self testing kits, optional home care of standard HIV. 2012 study alone showed about 35 million had HIV, and the results concluded antiretroviral therapy reduced the risk of transmission along with illness, and death, hoping high intakes of HIV and early ART testing could improve prevention, as well. The studied showed 58% of people took an HIV kit home (during 6 months of availability). 6.0 percent of the home-group study showed participants more likely to report a positive HIV self-test result than facility group participants (3.3 percent). A significantly greater proportion of adults in the home group initiated antiretroviral therapy (2.2%) compared with the facility group (0.7%).

[color=white][b]Effortlessly Strengthening the Metabolism[/b][/color]  
Brown fat, known as healthy fat, is considered healthy due to its metabolically activeness. A healthy metabolism doesn't always mean weight loss but can also mean prevention of diabetes and other metabolic issues. For years, many scientists didn't believe that brown fat could be found in adults. Recent sleep studies were done on men ranging between different temperatures each month. Studies showed that by sleeping in cooler temperatures (66 degrees F) for only four weeks,  the amount of brown fat in the body can almost double. Along with the doubling of the brown fat, the cooler temperatures caused the men to burn more calories throughout the day. These results from the study were undone when the men slept in 81 degrees for four weeks. After sleeping in higher temperatures, scientists noted that the men had even less brown fat than to begin with.[/align][/align][/spoiler]

Some archaeologists consider this wreckage a battlefield frozen in time.

[b][color=white]New "World's Tallest Building"[/color][/b]
Currently, in fastest changing country on the planet, the tallest building is being constructed at this very moment. This building will be the taller of two towers in Hubei, a province near the center of China. It is planned to be one kilometer (0.6 miles) tall. This is 172 meters (564 feet) taller than the Burj Khalifa in Dubai, which currently holds the record for tallest building. These towers will be more than just mere buildings, they are planned to be works of art with each aspect of them representing something new. For example, the towers will be colored pink to reflect the stunning sunsets in the region.

[b][color=white]The Cradle Civilization: Then and Now[/color][/b]
Between the Tigris and Euphrates Rivers, one of the first civilizations was formed in what is today Iraq. However, this region has seen quite the amount of turbulence and change. Around the seventh century, the split in Islam into Sunni and Shiite is where much of this began. Then on top of that, the trading between empires and powers would only further complicate conflicts into what it is today. It has gone from early Caliphates to the Ottoman Empire to the rise and fall of Saddam Hussein, and finally the rise of the ISIS. This rise of the ISIS could possibly mean the erasing of the boarder between Iraq and Syria. One can only say so much from the other side of the globe and can only hope for the best.[/align][/spoiler][/align]

[b][color=white]Jeff Goldblum Engaged to Emilie Livingston[/color][/b]
This July 8th, Jeff Goldblum, 61, proposed to 31-year-old Emilie Livingston after holding a relationship that began in 2012. Goldblum then flew Livingston out to a romantic trip in Maui. Emilie couldn’t resist the temptation of sharing her happiness on Twitter, saying "Jul 8 he proposed @ our fave #okstore. I was taken over by tears of joy n ecstasy! We picked the ring 2gether #inlove." This will be the [i]Jurrasic Park[/i] star’s third marriage, for Goldblum had previously married actresses Patricia Gaul from 1980 to 1986 and Geena Davis from 1987 to 1990.

[b][color=white]Sandra Bullock Comes Face-to-face with Stalker[/color][/b]
Sandra Bullock came face-to-face with the man who broke into her home last month. The break-in allegedly occurred June 8th. Sandra heard a loud banging and found Joshua Corbett in the hallway, wearing dark clothing, and rushed to shut the door and call 911. Neither Bullock nor her son were injured in the incident. The source  also claims Corbett was carrying handwritten notes, one of which said "I will forever be thinking of you and Louie, my son, as you are my wife by law, the law of God and you belong to me and me to you."

[b][color=white]Chrissy Teignen States she Was Fired for Being Fat[/color][/b]
Sports illustrated cover model Chrissy Teigen revealed in a video interview with DuJour magazine that she was fired from a Forever 21 shoot for being “fat”. She says, "I actually was fired from a job, Forever 21. They booked me directly when I was much younger and I showed up on set, they asked me if they could take a photo. And they shoot that photo off to my agency, who then calls me as I'm sitting in the makeup chair. And they say, 'You need to leave right now. They just said you are fat, and you need to come get your measurements taken," she recalled. "And I hate you, Forever 21. I hate you so much. Honestly you are the worst," Teigen added.

[b][color=white] Adam Levine Marries Longtime Girlfriend[/color][/b]
That's right. The [i]Maroon 5[/i] singer is officially tying the knot with his longtime girlfriend, Behati Prinsloo. The wedding is set to take place on July 19th, in Cabo San Lucas, Mexico. The rest of the band is confirmed to make an appearance during the event, along with a performance from the singer Stevie Nicks. The 35 year old groom took to Facebook during the day of the ceremony to post, “Let's do this." Levine and his Victoria's Secret model girlfriend made it official in front of almost 300 people. Notable guests include Robert Downey Jr., Jonah Hill, and fellow model Candice Swanepoel.

[b][color=white] Brad Pitt and Angelina Jolie are Back on the Big Screen[/color][/b]
This famous Hollywood couple is returning to the scene with a new movie, [i] By the Sea.[/i] Jolie will write and direct the film herself, whilst co-starring alongside her partner, Pitt. The last time the two starred in a movie together was the 2005 film [i]Mr. and Mrs. Smith,[/i] which changed them from co-stars to couple. Jolie and Pitt have 6 children, who are also said to be making an appearance in the film, making it a family get together.

[b][color=white]Maverick Star Dies at 86[/color][/b]
James Garner, the star of the 1950's TV series [i]Maverick[/i], passed away in his Los Angeles home on Saturday. The 86 year old's career kicked off back in the early 50's with theater performances. One thing led to another, and he landed the role of Bret Maverick, acting in the show until 1960. His performances scored him a Golden Globe award for most promising male newcomer in 1958 and an Emmy nomination in 1959. After his passing, many celebrities paid tribute to the actor, including Piers Morgan, John Stamos, and Kaley Cuoco.

[b][color=white]Lionel Ferbos Plays His Last Song[/color][/b]
Lionel Ferbos, believed to be the oldest active musician in New Orleans, passed away after  celebrating his 103rd birthday on Thursday. He began playing the trumpet in the early 1930's as a 15 year old, and continued his career until the time of his death. Despite having asthma as a child, he took up the trumpet and worked on perfecting his craft throughout the years. He performed as the lead trumpeter in several major orchestras and countless local gigs within his hometown, aka the birthplace of jazz. Ferbos also spent part of his life looking after the family's metalworking business, with some of his creations featured in museums.

[b][color=white]Weird Al Yankovic Releases New Album Following Internet Campaign[/color][/b]
Master of the musical parody since the 70's, "Weird" Al Yankovic is back with a new album and a killer online presence. If you frequent Reddit, Youtube, Yahoo, or any of the internet's top video and comedy providers, chances are you've caught wind of Yankovic's new campaign. Utilizing popular outlets such as College Humor and Funny or Die, Weird Al has garnered tens of millions of views on his videos throughout the past week, and there are more to come. This move is a stroke of genius; Al gets to produce and release his videos, and the content providers get their own Weird Al exclusive! He even hosted a (second) Reddit AMA last week, and his new content has been dominating the website. Parodying chart-toppers such as "Blurred Lines", "Happy", and "Royals", Weird Al released his new album, [i]Mandatory Fun[/i], on July 19th and it quickly climbed to the #1 spot on iTunes.

[b][color=white]Casey Kasem's Body Missing[/color][/b]
Casey Kasem, legendary DJ and radio personality whose voice is perhaps best known as that of Shaggy's from [i]Scooby Doo[/i], passed away on June 15 to family disputes regarding the man's assets. These disputes have recently escalated after Kasem's body was found to be missing from his funeral home prior to his planned burial. Kerri Kasem, his daughter, claims that his wife stole the body from the funeral home following the family feud between her and Casey's children. She denies these accusations, but police say the matter is an ongoing investigation.

[b][color=white]Ill Mind of Hopsin 7[/color][/b]
"Ill Mind of Hopsin 7", the newest installment in the rapper's long running series, touches on a topic that most rappers never write about; through profound lyrics Hopsin expresses his views on religion and death. Claiming to have turned to God in 2012, Hopsin was very outspoken about his newfound Christian beliefs. In his latest release, however, he questions his own previous statements. Saying "[i]I've been told my sinful life is an addiction/but I can't buy it, it's too hard to stand beside it[/i]," and [i]Man, what if Jesus was a facade?/Then that would mean the government's god[/i]," Hopsin expresses his own struggle with his faith and brings up a question that everyone, religious or not, has asked themself: what happens after death? To hear the full song, check out the [url=http://m.youtube.com/watch?v=QBsA2ETp7JA]official video[/url].

[b][color=white]Blues Guitarist Johnny Winter Dies at Age 70[/color][/b]
Blues guitarist and legend Johnny Winter has died at the age of 70. Winter has had the career of a lifetime, and his achievements in the world of blues range from playing with blues pioneer Muddy Waters to being named the 65th best guitarist in the world by [i]Rolling Stones[/i] magazine. Winter reportedly died in his hotel room in Zurich, Switzerland. The cause of death has not been provided. What will happen to Winter's tour dates and soon to come album is currently unknown. What is certainly known, though, is the fact that Winters will be missed both as a blues artist and a guitarist.

[b][color=white]Primus Drummer Suffers Heart Attack[/color][/b]
Word came on Friday afternoon that Tim Alexander, drummer for the bands Primus and Puscifer, has suffered a heart attack. Alexander has been having heart problems for quite a while now and is expected to have bypass procedure to remove blockage from arteries near his heart on Monday or Tuesday.

[b][color=white]Adam Levine and Behati Prinsloo "Married" [/color][/b]
Adam Levine is now able to add groom to his many list of achievements, which include Maroon 5 Frontman as well as judge on [i]The Voice[/i]. That's right, Adam Levine and [i]Victoria's Secret[/i] model Behati Prinsloo have officially said their I do's and tied the knot tight. Adam and Behati began dating in 2012, making their first red carpet appearance together at the GQ Gentlemen's Ball in New York. They became engaged in July 2013. The wedding took place in Mexico, with a ceremony that only lasted 20 minutes. Congratulations to the happy couple.
[/align][/spoiler][/align]
