[b][color=white]James Garner Dead at 86[/color][/b]
Primarily known for his roles on various TV shows but also for his major roles in movies such as [i]Grand Prix[/i], and most recently his big role in [i]The Notebook[/i], James Garner has passed away. Born James Scott Baumgarner in Oklahoma in 1928, he lost his mother when he was just four. Dropping out of high school at 16, Garner joined the merchant marine navy, only to suffer from chronic sea sickness, forcing him to quit and move to Los Angeles to live with his father. He had various odd jobs from small market roles to spending time as a mens swimsuit model until he finally found his way to the film stage. This would be short-lived, however, as he was soon drafted into the military for the Korean War, where he was wounded twice while serving as infantry. After being discharged, he attended the University of Oklahoma while working with his father as a carpet layer. Not soon after, he scored a part in a Broadway-bound play called [i]The Caine Mutiny Court-Martial[/i]. He had zero lines, but he made an impact and was signed the following year by Warner Bros. It was television that truly pushed Garner into the spotlight as a pop culture icon with two very big television roles. In 1957, he became the face of the TV Western [i]Maverick[/i], playing the quick-witted gambler, a role that began to evolve as the writers played to his comic abilities. After leaving the show in 1960, two years before it ended, he returned to film work. He found his true calling once again in 1974 with [i]The Rockford Files[/i]. Garner won an Emmy for his role in the series in 1977 and continued acting until medical issues forced him to stop in 1980. He is survived by his wife, Lois, and his daughter and step-daughter. He was 86.

[b][color=white]Star Wars: Episode VII Plot Details Revealed?[/color][/b]
As expected, JJ Abrams has been very hush hush about his plans for the [i]Star Wars[/i] reboot, [i]Star Wars: Episode VII[/i]. Filming has been taking place at Pinewood Studios in Buckinghamshire, UK. Rumors of his plot have been leaked according to a post by [url=http://badassdigest.com/2014/07/20/exclusive-star-wars-episode-vii-plot-details-revealed/]Badass Digest[/url]. According to the post, the film will start with the opening crawl panning to reveal Luke Skywalker's severed hand, still holding the lightsaber that Obi-Wan gave him in the first film. The lightsaber falls to a desert planet  where it is found by Daisy Ridley's character and the character played by John Boyega, who is reportedly a Stormtrooper who has deserted his unit in an attempt to change his life. They recognize it as a Jedi relic and set out to learn more about it. They eventually meet Han Solo and his partner Chewie, who recognize its origin and tell them that its owner has not been seen in 30 years, since the events of film we know as [i]Return Of The Jedi[/i]. That is not all though; on a distant ice planet in another galaxy, someone is building a new and more powerful super-weapon that could rival that of the Death Star. More details are expected to be released sometime soon, if at all. [i]Star Wars: Episode VII[/i] is set to release on December 18, 2015.

[b][color=white]Dawn Of The Planet Of The Apes Conquers the US Box Office[/color][/b]
Look out! Not only have the apes taken over the planet in the latest [i]Planet Of The Apes[/i] movie, but they have also taken over the US Box Office. The latest [i]Apes[/i] movie earned $36 million this weekend, down roughly 50%, but still made more than enough to keep the top Box Office spot yet again. [i]Dawn Of The Planet Of The Apes[/i] has earned more than $138.9 million in the US alone and more than $171 million globally with plenty of territories left to open in thanks to delays from the World Cup. Set as a prequel to the Apes series, it has managed to do considerably better than its previous films and looks to make a strong final push into next week as more films are due to hit theaters.

[b][color=white] The Strain [/color][/b]
[i]The Strain[/i] is a highly anticipated new hit, that premiered on FX on July 13, 2014.You can watch it on Sundays at 10 P.M. It was created by Guillermo del Toro and Chuck Hogan, based on their novel trilogy of the same name. A brand new thriller that tells the story of the head of the "CDC" or Center for Disease Control in New York City. His team is called upon to investigate a new and strange viral outbreak that seems to be caused by an ancient and evil strain of vampirism. Every day is a fight to survive for humanity. [i]The Strain[/i] has scared an 8.5 out of 10 in IMDb. This new show is definitely worth a watch.

[b][color=white]Extant[/color][/b]
Extant has a few notable actors such as Halle Berry, Hiroyuki Sanada, and Brad Beyer. The series is created by Mickey Fisher.  A short plot of this new exciting series is that after spending a year in space, where she stayed to conduct experiments, astronaut Molly Watts (Halle Berry) tries to resume a normal life with her husband John and her son Ethan. Ethan is not their biological son as Molly is infertile, which means she is not able to get pregnant. Ethan is designed by his father John as the first prototype of a future of "Humanichs", or what you would call "human robots". But Molly's return is putting many people at risk, not just herself but the entire mankind. This show has earned a 7.7 out of 10 on IMDb. Beyond the show being futuristic it is an excellent watch, not only for the younger crowd but the old as well. You can watch Extant Wednesdays on CBS at 9 P.M. Eastern time.

[b][color=white]Rush[/color][/b]
A new USA drama series, [i]Rush[/i] scored a 7.1 out of 10 on IMDb, and premiers on Fridays.  Some actors you may or may not have heard of are in "Rush", these actors.actresses are, Teach Grant, Tom Ellis, and Billy Lush.This is just after Rush's first episode. The show follows a Dr. William Rush, who is not your average on-call doctor. Rush is not attached to any hospital whatsoever, and requires a cash-only premium to work very discreetly. Rush has no desire to change his life or how he lives it, until an old woman appears. Suddenly he decides to change his ways to get a second chance.
